thread.title: Women in the World conference: See the inspiring women who spoke at Day 2
thread.title_full: Women in the World conference: See the inspiring women who spoke at Day 2

title: Women in the World conference: See the inspiring women who spoke at Day 2
text:
Women in the World conference: See the inspiring women who spoke at Day 2 Women in the World conference: See the inspiring women who spoke at Day 2 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Many familiar female faces took to the stage at London’s Cadogan Hall for the Women in the World conference. 
Model Chantelle Winnie and singer Nina Nesbitt spoke about social media and the impact body confidence has on individuals and society as a whole. (Lauren Hurley/PA) 
Nicole Kidman discussed how she’s defining this creative phase of her life and career. (Lauren Hurley/PA) 
Cara Delevingne talked about what she has learned in her young life and lightning-fast rise to fame. (Dominic Lipinski/PA) 
Oh, and her buddy Kendall Jenner came along to show her support too. 
Theresa May discussed what it’s like to be the longest serving British Home Secretary in England’s history. (Lauren Hurley/PA) 
Nicola Sturgeon spoke about what it’s like to be the first woman to serve as leader of the Scottish National Party. (Dominic Lipinski/PA) Share article 
And 21-year-old Member of Parliament Mhairi Black spoke about her impassioned maiden speech in the House of Commons. (Dominic Lipinski/PA)
